meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the west wind.
meanings.sent1: The favonian breeze gently rustled the leaves on the trees.
meanings.sent2: The sailors welcomed the favonian wind as it pushed their ship towards the shore.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned into a favonian affair when the wind blew away all the napkins.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a favonian melody, light and refreshing.
meanings.sent5: The children's kites soared high in the sky, carried by the favonian currents.

meanings.sent1: The exam results were favonian, bringing smiles to the students' faces.
meanings.sent2: The team considered the weather to be favonian for their outdoor game.
meanings.sent3: Finding a parking spot right in front of the store felt like a favonian stroke of luck.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected job offer was a favonian turn of events in his life.
meanings.sent5: The flowers bloomed beautifully under the favonian conditions of the garden.
